subject: Ethics
title: Dark Patterns in Privacy Settings
description: One-minute skill: Dark Patterns in Privacy Settings.

hook.text: Ever tried deleting your Facebook account? It's buried six clicks deep. Sharing your data? Just one click.

buildup.text: Dark patterns are design tricks that manipulate users into giving up more data than they intended.

discovery.text: Common tricks: pre-checked consent boxes, confusing double negatives, and 'accept' buttons in bright colors.

twist.text: LinkedIn paid $13 million for dark patterns that tricked users into spamming their contacts. Design deceives at scale.

climax.text: When 'privacy-friendly' options are deliberately hard to find, the interface itself becomes a form of coercion.

punchline.text: If saying no is harder than saying yes, it's not a real choice.

quiz.question: What are 'dark patterns' in privacy settings?
options: Design tricks that manipulate users into giving up more data
